conclusion: Analyze forces on the conductor rod to determine power dissipated in the resistor.
Two parallel metal rails on a horizontal surface connected to a resistor R; conductor rod MN with mass m on rails; uniform magnetic field B directed vertically downward; rod slides right at speed v.
Identify forces on rod: magnetic force F, kinetic friction μmg, external force F_ext, weight mg.
Magnetic force F is given by F = BvS, where S is the cross-sectional area of the rod.
Net force on rod: F_ext - μmg = BvS + mg.
Using Newton's second law, find acceleration: a = (F_ext - μmg)/m = g + (BvS/m).
Power dissipated in resistor R is P = I^2R.
Determine current I: I = F_ext/(BS) = (mg + (BvS/m) * m)/(B * S) = g * (m/B) + v.
Power dissipated in the resistor is P = (g * (m/B) + v)^2R.
Final answer: Power dissipated in resistor R is (g * (m/B) + v)^2R.
